definition: Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
night
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar

sentences.english: Lantern Festival day everywhere decorated, beaming.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節這天到處張燈結綵，喜氣洋洋。

sentences.english: Part of the lantern festival tradition involves a game to guess riddles attached to the lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節傳統習俗中還有一部分是關於猜燈謎的遊戲。

sentences.english: It will take place on the day of the Lantern Festival on the Yanshui Junior High School athletic field.
sentences.chinese: 這些活動將在元宵節當天於鹽水國中操場進行施放。

sentences.english: There are many legends concerning the origins of Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 關於元宵節的來歷有很多傳說。

sentences.english: Hence, the custom of hanging lanterns during the lantern Festival came into being.
sentences.chinese: 據說從此以後，就有了元宵掛燈的風俗。

sentences.english: People release sky lanterns to celebrate the Lantern Festival in Pingsi District, New Taipei City on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 民衆上週六在新北市平溪區平溪國中施放天燈慶元宵。

sentences.english: In the Han Emperor, has been ordered fifteenth day as the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在漢文帝時，已下令將正月十五定爲元宵節。

sentences.english: Tracy: On the night of the festival, people go on streets with a variety of lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節的晚上，人們會提着各式各樣的燈籠上街。

sentences.english: Beijing to do the Lantern Festival is a production-based stuffing.
sentences.chinese: 北京做的元宵，是以餡爲基礎製作的。

sentences.english: Lantern Festival is generally considered the last day of the Chinese Lunar New Year.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節一般被認爲是中國新春佳節的最後一天。

sentences.english: The city provides a firework display for the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 吉林市在元宵節那天舉行了焰火晚會。

sentences.english: The dumplings are made of sticky rice flour stuffed with different fillings.
sentences.chinese: 元宵由糯米粉製成，跟餃子一樣佐以不同餡料。

sentences.english: However, on this year First Night Festival I will not forget my habitual old black-haired people;
sentences.chinese: 不過，今年元宵節我不要忘記老習慣的烏頭人民。

sentences.english: Tomorow is Lation Festval, I'll go back home and stay with my family then.
sentences.chinese: 明天是元宵節，我會回家同家人過節。

sentences.english: Thinking of you and wish you a Happy Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 快樂的元宵之際，謹致我的想念與祝福。

sentences.english: The important activity is watching lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵主要的活動就是看燈。

definition: Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
boiled balls of glutinous rice flour, eaten during the Lantern Festival
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
lunar New Year's Eve
the Mid-autumn festival, the traditional moon-viewing festival on the 15th of the 8th lunar month
Laba congee, ceremonial rice porridge dish eaten on the 8th day of the 12th month in the Chinese calendar
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
mooncake (esp. for the Mid-Autumn Festival)
kind of dumpling/sticky rice ball
the New Year festival
variant of 糕[gao1]
Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
Spring Festival (Chinese New Year)
to see in the New Year/to stay up all night on lunar New Year's Eve
